text:
e="preserve">Kenneth Charles "Ken" Swofford (July 25, 1933 – November 1, 2018) was an American actor. He was born in Du Quoin, Illinois.
Between 1962 and 1995, Swofford's movie roles included "Thelma & Louise", "Skyjacked", "Black Roses" and "The Andromeda Strain".
Swofford appeared on such television series as "Fame", "Switch", "The Oregon Trail", "Rich Man, Poor Man Book II", "Murder, She Wrote", and as a cast member of the mystery series "Ellery Queen".
Swofford died on November 1, 2018 in Garden Grove, California at the age of 85.

annotations.surface_form: Rich Man, Poor Man Book II
